intro: Artemisia laricifolia, commonly known as the mountain sage, is a perennial shrub native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in late summer. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Its leaves contain essential oils that contribute to its strong, distinctive scent. Artemisia laricifolia is also valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally by indigenous peoples for various health purposes.
